Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: K. Shaffer
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for use in the bedroom for Netflix streaming only (don't actually have it hooked up to cable).  So far it has met my expectations and works great.  My house is wired with Cat6 Ethernet, so I literally had to plug the power cord and a network cable into the wall outlets and I was good to go.Netflix setup was a breeze, was watching movies within a few minutes of first turning the TV on.  The built-in Netflix app seems to have everything you would want (I could pick up right where I left off on a movie I had been watching on my tablet).I only noticed a few glitches in the streaming and only once did it display a "rebuffering" screen.  No complaints about the picture quality of the TV at all (I knew this wasn't going to be a fantastic 1080p 120Hz experience, but given what I'm using it for, there was no need to spend another $500 or more for that).Overall, I'm very very happy with my purchase.  Amazon had it shipped to me for free within 2 days, certainly can't complain about that!

Reviews.Title: Pass
Reviews.Author: R. E. CARLISLE "He's just this guy"
Reviews.Content: The set has plenty of features.  The picture is of acceptable quality for the size and price of the set.  But the Audio is horrible.  The net applications are minimal, no browser.  Netflix items take an inordinate time to load, but I have not tried it with the Set hardwired, that may make a big difference.  The DLNA streaming works well, much better than my hardwired Samsung.But as for the low rating; this is the forth LCD TV of approximately this size that I have owned, one other Toshiba, an Akai, and a Samsung.  The audio in the others is fine, even in the other Toshiba.  The sound seems to becoming out of a tin can with this one.  Even after manipulating all the settings, something I have much experience with, it got no better.  And quite often the sound crackles during transitions in audio level. Rather than return the TV I purchased a sound bar.  The sound is so bad I wonder if I received a defective set.

Reviews.Title: Broken Already
Reviews.Author: Anon
Reviews.Content: This TV only worked for a month and then just refused to turn on! Screen is blank and I can't do anything with it. Really hoping this doesn't require shipping the TV off somewhere.

Reviews.Title: 1st Impressions
Reviews.Author: Bradley Thompson
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me state that I received the TV yesterday. I have scanned for the available channels on my Comcast cable and I have set the TV networking up for a wireless connection. I plan on running a hardwired ethernet connection within the week.Inside the box - TV & stand, 2AA batteries, a few adverts for internet video companies & a ridiculous simplistic manual.Set up is very easy. The TV prompts you to scan for channels 1st thing. The TV did find every channel that I am aware of on my cable system, both SD & HD. Next, I choose to remove all SD channels. In my manual, it does not explain how to do this. I figured it out by playing in the menu. Under the setup menu, you have to select manual program, then you check the channels that you do NOT want. I really do not understand what that little thingie above the checkspot means. It looks like a little period with a curving arrow over the top of it. Must be a Japanese symbol. Anyways, click & forget it.Next I set up my wireless connection. I used all 3 options to set up the TV. The one I preferred is the assisted scan. It detects my wireless network & I only had to input my login security key. The TV connected with b/g compatibility instead of using n. Netflix looked great; I have not tried an other internet services yet.After all that, the TV prompted me to update its firmware. I did it wirelessly and noticed no problems. It only took a few minutes to complete.Picture quality leaves some things to be desired. I have not had time to set the parameters to my liking so it may improve.One glaring omission on the TV is the lack of a clock. Since this TV is really just one big flat computer, that is unacceptable. I am debating sending the TV back for just that reason. I would prefer Toshiba write it into firmware on the next update but I may not wait to see if that happens.I did test the DLNA video streaming. Like most other electronics that have the ability, it is a joke. I have several different shares across multiple windows 7 pcs and the TV could not see any of them. I checked some of my network media players and they saw the shares just fine. DLNA is not reliable so do not depend on this TV as your player. I plan on attaching a network media player to the TV so this does not affect my opinion of the TV.I may or may not update this review after I get the TV hardwired into my gigabit network. If my opinion changes considerably, I will update it.------2nd impressionsThe remote is cluttered with too many buttons. I do not really know what they are all for. Toshiba could have programmed multiple functions into the buttons depending on what area of the TV you were in.My dvd player is a Toshiba and it has a conflicting button with the TV. The TV remote button Channel Return conflicts with the Play button on the dvd player remote. This is aggravating and probably enough to return the TV for. IF Toshiba is reading the reviews, please update the firmware and change the code for that one button.The HDMI connections are extremely sensitive. If is does not like a hdmi wire, the picture will blink every few seconds. I used several different cables and it will only accept a few. I know that all of the cables are good too, I use them on other HD tvs.One other aggravating thing about the TV is that it forgets the network password occasionally. While I do intend on using a hardwired connection, this makes me wonder.

Reviews.Title: Excellent all-rounder TV
Reviews.Author: DrAmar
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for $330 on Amazon and it was promptly shipped in 2 days flat for free!Pros :1) Amazing Picture Clarity - LED definitely better than just LCD2) Superb Remote - The best I had so far. With All you Need.3) Dazzling Looks4) Easy Setup5) Great Value for MoneyCons :1) Sound not that great ( as with other flat panels)2) Youtube - Not user friendly; No stored history.3) Yahoo Widgets - Don't match other TV appsOverall, I am much satisfied with the purchase and would highly recommend this TV!

Reviews.Title: Died 1st Day of Ownership
Reviews.Author: bandgirl06
Reviews.Content: This TV was great for the first couple hours - the day after setting it up it died. I would hit the power button on either the remote or the actual TV and the TV LED would blink green a couple times, a couple more times, and then turn on 10 or so seconds later. I called Toshiba and they requested I send it in for repair for "power failure."Nothing should ever leave the factory without some level of testing - which Toshiba apparently does not understand.

Reviews.Title: Good TV. Works well so far
Reviews.Author: Deepika Mahajan
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for almost a month and so far it works great. The ability to connect to the internet is quite useful as one does not need a blue ray player. Picture is excellent and the sounds is OK - I don't put it very high so have not noticed the issues that others have had with LED TVs.The remote looks cool. One thing though - I still haven't been able to locate the manual controls on the TV so have to use remote.

Reviews.Title: Made to break
Reviews.Author: Daniel Nichols "CP Padre"
Reviews.Content: Toshiba despite knowing that their products contain faulty main power boards refuses to issue a recall. The blinking light of death has affected thousands of Toshiba customers but instead of doing the right and ethical thing, Toshiba has chosen to ignore the issue and rip off all those who bought there products. Search for Toshiba no power or toshiba blinking light and you will be shocked. We had our TV that we paid over $1200 for for less than four years and it just stopped working. They know about the problem yet do nothing to address it.

Reviews.Title: Lacks Basic Features as Media Player
Reviews.Author: Fantomouse "Fantomouse"
Reviews.Content: Extremely poor codec. It won't play or recognize many media files from any source. It won't display basic subtitle either - none from dlna server!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Great piece of history
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the tv. It is truly a great product. It is very crisp and clear. It honestly exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: The TV is Very good
Reviews.Author: Amer West Henrry
Reviews.Content: The Television the brilliant. The WIFI works well and the sound is very good. For my room it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Awesome but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Fedex23
Reviews.Content: This tv is great but when I hooked up my ps3 with an hdmi cable every so often I get a static bar on the bottom of the screen. It goes away if you change the pic size or if you switch the input then switch back. To get rid of this you just need a surge protector.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: YNH
Reviews.Content: Resolution is wonderful, and the best bang for the buck! I recommend this to anyone looking for a flat screen for their kids or even adults.

Reviews.Title: Not worth buying this television
Reviews.Author: Jonak Biswas
Reviews.Content: I bought this television with a thanks giving deal.Even though the reviews were not great.Pro1. Wifi Enabled2. Network Ready3. Good Picture qualityCons1. Apps are limited and cannot add / remove apps.2. The remote works weirdly. Sometimes you will not be able to use the remote to work. it freezes3. Had to change the printed circuit board of the TV twice. good thing was (it was under warranty).4. The customer service is pathetic.5. With no reason the TV will restart.6. Sometimes you will not be able to turn on the TV with remote or manually. (Screen of Death).Looks like got stuck with the product. I do not know why Amazon even sells Toshiba televisions.The worst letevision ever manufactured by any company. Do not buy Toshiba Televisions.Please read other reviews about Toshiba Televisions and the screen of death

Reviews.Title: Complete junk
Reviews.Author: patty
Reviews.Content: This TV is worse than pirated chinese garbage.  The remote *will* stop working within about 1 year, and it isn't the remote that's broken, it's the electronic on the TV itself.  Just do a search, there are thousands of such complaints, and Toshiba will do nothing for you if it's out of warranty.  But even when it is working, the sound is aweful, and the internet apps are pretty much worthless other than netflix.  I bought this TV in spite of complaints about the sound quality, because I owned another Toshiba TV that lasted for 20 years.  But, now their products are poorly designed and no quality control in parts, so I won't ever buy Toshiba anything again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!  Love it.
Reviews.Author: Scott Bailey
Reviews.Content: Good product.  Netflix app works great.  PC Input works great for streaming ball games.  Vendor did an excellent job as well.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with Toshiba
Reviews.Author: R. Winget
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for just over a year and I'm very happy with it.  The picture is great and it handles SD channels well.  The sound is about average (but what do you expect with something so thin).  The startup time is a tad slow but I haven't had any trouble with the remote or power supply as other reviewers have.  I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 32sl415u
Reviews.Author: charles murray
Reviews.Content: The product arrived two days early and was packaged{double boxed}very well.The unit works very well and I am satisfied.However there are competitive units that sell for less.

Reviews.Title: WiFi causes TV to malfunction.
Reviews.Author: saturn5
Reviews.Content: I have this 32" LED Toshiba smart tv.  It randomly powers off and on, becomes unresponsive, etc. when it is connected to the WiFi.  I have tried it on several wireless routers and modems, as well as with nothing else on the network.  I have also tried it in multiple other homes.Toshiba has sent techs to my home 4 times.  4 times I have been asked to take time off work to meet a tech.  The nearest tech to me comes from 100 miles away and Toshiba pays them mileage and wages to come "fix" the tv.  Each time has failed to resolve the issue, and I can confirm, without a doubt, that the WiFi is the issue.Toshiba is now refusing product replacement, instead wanting to replace the power/main boards, AGAIN.  They are doing this because now if it solves the problem for 30 days, the warranty is up.  I cannot believe that they would not just replace the TV instead of investing thousands into it - it only cost $380 NEW.I haven't been able to use the TV's smart features since October (it is not Feb.), and most of that time was spent figuring out what was wrong with it - no thanks to the techs or customer support.  I didn't buy this tv to have a non-wireless connection.  I bought the tv to work on WiFi, and it does not.  I would like the Wifi fixed, or a refund.  NOT ANOTHER TECH.I can't recommend this television to anyone.  Even if the product was good, the flaw in customer service warrants the one star rating.

Reviews.Title: Very good LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Carlos Martinez
Reviews.Content: I must say I'm very happy with this television.I bought this HDTV becuase my father needed a new one so I gave him my 32 inch Panasonic Viera LCD and got myself this one and it has worked very very well since the day I set it up. This TV comes with a lot of little add-ons like yahoo and netflix but honestly I've never used them (Some of them I can't because I live in Venezuela) and I mostly use it to watch videos from my laptop or play on my PS3 and for that it looks great and sounds great as well. It's also nice that it comes with some audio jacks so i can also plug my wireless headphones and play without making noise in the night. The SD display (like AV) don't look very well but this is normal for a HD designed TV and it doesn't bother me but it must be mentioned.The only small problem I found with this TV is that the VGA (PC) display from my desktop computer looked very misplaced and I couldnt fix it.I still recommend this HDTV to anybody who wants a light and very sharp TV for HD purposes.

Reviews.Title: Did not even last a year!
Reviews.Author: Unhappy Customer
Reviews.Content: T.v. will not turn on. Called Toshiba since it is still under warranty (it's only been 9 months since I received the t.v.)and now I have to wait 4 to 5 business days just to schedule an appointment with a tech. Bad power board. Seems like a common issue. Definitely the last Toshiba t.v. I will ever purchase.

Reviews.Title: The remote is the problem
Reviews.Author: K.D.
Reviews.Content: TV works fine, looks good, but it seems that the remote is the problem, at first it was communicating very slowly with the TV, now it's not working at all even with the new batteries, the remote is crucial because I can't access the Internet capabilities without it. I'm going to get in contact with Pinnacle deals now.

Reviews.Title: Never Again!
Reviews.Author: Aditya Kedia
Reviews.Content: Toshiba...lets see..TV out of service for the 4th time in 11 months...everytime its the same issue- main board...takes 6-7 weeks for Toshiba to send some one to replace the main board. Also, Toshiba outsources the job to some local company which take their sweet time to come to your place. Their Customer service is nothing short of a disaster. I don't know how they are still in Business..need to be reported to Consumer Act. Never buy a Toshiba product again. They only wait for your warranty to get over so that they can close your case. This company treats their customers as shit..they are 10 times worse than Dell. I am positive the good reviews are written by the company employees

Reviews.Title: Not satisfied
Reviews.Author: Customer review
Reviews.Content: The tv was really nice but unfortunately the product was defected. It wouldn't shut off nor did the remote work. On top of that I had to pay $130 to ship it back and Electronic Express still hasn't given me my reimbursement. I pretty much paid $130 to have a defected product sent to me. If I could give it 0 stars I totally would.

Reviews.Title: Impressive
Reviews.Author: Muse "Chells"
Reviews.Content: So far so good. Only con for me is no Amazon dreaming service built in. A huge plus is that it sees my media server on my computer so I can stream from my home system.  I have only had a minor issue with the wireless streaming and I'm fairly certain it's due to what else was running on my home system.  The touch control on the side for power and other items is a nice feature and the remote has a number of nice smart functions.It's extremely light and I have it on a low profile turntable so I can move it for visibility while I'm in other areas of the room.  I got this refurbished and have had it since early Dec 2011.  No complaints thus far, I don't regret the buy.

Reviews.Title: not good
Reviews.Author: Dawnden
Reviews.Content: The tv worked great for the whole 2 days I got to use it. Then the whole bottom half the screen went fuzzy. Now I am currently still waiting on amazon for my replacement guess I will let you guys know if that one ends up working ok. Unhappy with Amazon at the time also because I put in for my replacement on the 3rd and the item still hasn't shipped out because all of a sudden they are out of stock and I have to wait. But im suppose to send the broken one back now.

Reviews.Title: Not the best
Reviews.Author: S. Dalton "expect customer service"
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this tv even though I love Toshiba usually.  I bought it because it was net ready but the response time from turning it on to changing channels is terrible.  I would rate the picture about a 4.5 but the remote is cumbersome and difficult to use.  It's heavy and bulky on the top and thin on the bottom which makes it very uncomfortable.  The buttons are too tiny and barely raised.  The sound is ok but the volume control is terrible. Setting up the internet on this tv isn't simple and I'm fairly proficient with technology.  Overall I would say keep looking.  There are better choices.  I considered returning it but was simply too busy and now I'm regretting this purchase. It will eventually be put in a guest room and I'll find a better tv for the master.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - small sound
Reviews.Author: Western-NY "hurler2000"
Reviews.Content: This is a great 32" TV.  Out of the box and connected (wireless) to the internet in a couple of minutes.  The picture quality is fantastic.  Included directions are a little weak, but mst things are so easy you don't need them.  The only minor dissappointment was the sound quality.  Better than the Samsung TVs but still a little tinny.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!  Just got it out of the box
Reviews.Author: Heidi "heidihchandler"
Reviews.Content: We just ordered this because of the great price.  We paid $329.98.  We read the reviews and were prepared for terrible sound, and a mediocre picture, but for our intended use, we figured we could live with that for the price.The TV was easy to set-up.  Just 4 screws connect it the base, then plug in the cable antenna and power cord!  It found our cable channels and was easy to connect to the Internet.We were pleasantly surprised with the sound quality.  It isn't like a theater, but much better than what we expected.  There is a strange "half mute" setting that does make it sound like it is in a tin can.  When we got rid of the "half mute" setting, it was OK.The TV connected to the Internet just fine, but it doesn't have a web browser.  So, if you are OK with the built-in presets, Nextflix, Yahoo, etc., you are OK.  When connected to an HD source, I thought the picture and sound were both very good.  We haven't figured out a way to use it for streaming videos from Amazon without connecting it to another device.  We can't comment on reliability because we just took it out of the box.

Reviews.Title: List price incorrect
Reviews.Author: MC in WV
Reviews.Content: The list price for this TV is $579.99, not $679.99, according to the Toshiba web site. Great picture but the current Amazon price ($430) is not a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Netflix menu is good. Sound is weak. 15 seconds to warm up.
Reviews.Author: Carl Duffy
Reviews.Content: I like the TV overall.The sound is not high quality.The browse menu for Netflix is good.  I have a Panasonic Viera blue ray with Netflix and that one only allows you to watch movies that you already have in your queue which you create via the Netflix website, but the Toshiba allows you to find any movie through the TV menu.  The Panasonic methodology is better if you are trying to prevent your kids from surfing for inappropriate movies.The other features like Facebook are not worth bothering about because they are so clunky and unusable compared to a smartphone or computer.My biggest gripe is that it takes 15 seconds for the TV to turn on from a cold start.  If it has just been turned off it will restart in a second.  I'd like to know if others have the same issue?  If it's just me then I want to return this item.

Reviews.Title: Sending it back
Reviews.Author: S. Matthews
Reviews.Content: Not happy at all.  I opened the box up last night and began to set up this tv and had a lot of trouble because the remote control didn't work properly.  I called Toshiba and I was not happy with they way they treated me - they are not very friendly to put it mildly, I even got "accidently" hung up on the first time I called before I even got two words out.  When I called back and explained the problem I was on hold for the senior technician for well over 15 minutes and they said the remote control was the problem.  They would send me a new one, but I'd have to call back the next day to register the product first.  I just called and they cannot find the serial number.  So they require me to take a picture of the serial number, model number, and copy of the reciept (from amazon) and email or fax it to them.  Right now, I am so fuming mad that I have decided to just return the TV.  I am not happy with their customer service or the product.  Goodbye Toshiba - never again!  I'm going to go buy a Vizio or LG.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with picture and price.
Reviews.Author: AVconnection
Reviews.Content: This is what I was looking for and price was fantastic $329.The setup is tricky if you don't take the time to go through the menu on the remote. Don't bother looking at the paper work did not really help. Once you get in the menu set up,it should be easy. This is a 720p set, and up close it is not such a bad picture. now more than 7 feet I would not know. Takes time to warm up; dose not bother me personally. Sound is okay for 10x10 room and I have 30% of my hearing. I hope this helps others. I personally think any room more than a 10x10 you should be looking to a bigger set. wireless works well and said strong, with the router in another room, down the hall about 30 feet away. The price I paid was great because anything like it would have cost about $500. or more. There are better out there but not for this price.P.S. The remote if you want to program (took me some time because you try to read it from the manual online tells you to hold down a button and put in the codes) / (info) hold down info after pressing mode and punch in your code. Wish I knew 2 hours ago.New........ 1 year later and the batteries lasted longer. The tv turns off on it's own and turns back on. I never had a TV that break in just over a year. So you get what you pay for. I will buy another TV, just not a Toshiba. The Product is faulty and made to break. If you poke around you will see others having the same problem and Toshiba been selling this model for at least 2 years and know there are bad power supply and bad boards. So I wish you luck and hope it last longer for you.

Reviews.Title: Can Someone Help ME??
Reviews.Author: Alejandro Samson
Reviews.Content: I just got this tv about an hour ago. I hooked up my antenna and started watching tv imeadiately. When I tried to set up my ps3 however there were complications. I thought I would be as simple as pushing the AUX button, but to no avail the button would not work. also I have noticed that the majority of the buttons don't work, and the ones that do have a huge lag time...

Reviews.Title: Excellent wifi connected TV
Reviews.Author: Mike M. "Mike"
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before I bought this TV.  I'm adding my review because there weren't a lot of reviews for this particular TV. I've had the TV for a few weeks and I'm very happy with it so far.Pros:-The picture is very good in my opinion.-The TV is extremely thin and has an attractive form factor. It would be great for wall mounting although I haven't done this.-The wifi connection is great and the integrated Netflix works very well; I have yet to try the other internet features. The remote has a Netflix button that sends you directly to Netflix.  Very user friendly. Also, while this isn't a Netflix review, I just renewed my account after a few years and it seems like the online content has increased dramatically and is a great value for $8/month.-The TV has plenty of HDMI connections.-The TV is a great value at the price I paid ($369 on Amazon in December of 2011).Cons:-The sound quality is poor; however, after reading a lot of reviews of LED TVs I think this is par for the course. With the TVs being so thin, there just isn't room for large speakers. I use the TV in a bedroom and the sound is adequate but it could be an issue for a larger room.-The wifi connection takes a few minutes to connect; if you start Netflix immediately after turning the TV on, it will give you an error saying there is no connection.  I've learned that this is just due to a delay in establishing a wifi connection.-The TV doesn't currently offer access to Amazon's online videos (sorry Amazon). In theory, this could be changed via a software update but who knows when or if this will come.  I think there are other TVs that do offer this.Overall, I am very happy with my purchase and the pros more than outweigh the cons.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: bummydill
Reviews.Content: Everthing worked perfect. Wish i would have bought 2. I love this tv. Widgets are great and so easy to use.
